result.execSummary:
The defendant Armando Espinoza-Hipolito was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements by the end of probationary period. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never possess any gun or other firearms and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

-Treatment, if needed;
-Random urine screens to ensure compliance

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Armando Espinoza-Hipolito

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Armando Espinoza-Hipolito in court with Attorney Julius Andriusis.  Defendant Armando Espinoza-Hipolito in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Sworn:  Vickie Bermudez.

Matter here for plea/sentencing.  AS TO PLEA:  AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.  Appeals rights given.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Alejandra E., Rosalba E.-H. and Sophia E.-H.  AS TO COUNT #1:  The Court WITHHELD SENTENCE.  The Court ORDERS PROBATION for TWO (2) years.   

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
 - No controlled substances or alcohol;
 - AODA assessment; treatment, if needed;
 - Random urine screens to ensure compliance;
 - 190 days condition time at the House of Correction--STAYED;
 - Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements by the end of probationary period.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

Filed,
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Due to the Court being down on April 1, 2016, the matter was adjourned to May 4, 2016 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Attorney Julius Andriusis in court, defendant Armando Espinoza-Hipolito not in court, in custody.  Intern Joshua Dryak under the supervision of Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a status conference.  Matter is set for plea/sentencing on April 1, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Attorney Julius Andriusis in court, defendant Armando Espinoza-Hipolito not in court, in custody (not produced).  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a return on warrant.  The Defendant currently has an ICE hold on him.  The Court sets bail at $5,000 cash.  The Court set the matter for a status conference on the ICE hold for February 11, 2016 at 1:30pm and a status conference on all other pending matters on April 1, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
10/5/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Attorney Julius Andriusis in court.  Defendant Armando Espinoza-Hipolito not in court.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Status Conference.  The State and Defense indicated that the Defendant has been deported to Mexico.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant.  The Court ordered that the defendant is to be REMANDED to the trial court upon return on the bench warrant.  THE COURT ORDERED ANY BAIL ON DEPOSIT SHOULD BE RETURNED TO SURETY.

Attorney Julius Andriusis in court, defendant Armando Espinoza-Hipolito not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Scheduling Conference.  Stipulated request for adjournment, received and filed.  Matter adjourned to September 30, 2015 at 1:30pm for a status conference in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Attorney Julius Andriusis in court, defendant Armando Espinoza-Hipolito not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request an adjournment.
  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.
Case adjourned to 09-01-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 30, Judge Conen's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.

15RM030301  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/20/2015

Attorney Julius Andriusis in court, defendant Armando Espinoza-Hipolito not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request another scheduling conference date.
Case adjourned to 07-13-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.

Defendant Armando Espinoza-Hipolito in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Defendant Armando Espinoza-Hipolito in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:Brenda Bartholomew.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court entered a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Armando Espinoza-Hipolito in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Armando Espinoza-Hipolito in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

COURT ORDERS DNA SAMPLE TO BE OBTAINED BY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
